sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with singular matrices
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations with the following coefficient matrix, augmented matrix, and variables:

$$\begin{cases} 2x + 3y + z = 6\\ 3x + 5y + 2z = 12\\ 4x + 7y + 3z = 15 \end{cases}$$

where the coefficient matrix is \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 3 & 1 \\ 3 & 5 & 2 \\ 4 & 7 & 3 \end{bmatrix}, the augmented matrix is \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 3 & 1 & 6 \\ 3 & 5 & 2 & 12 \\ 4 & 7 & 3 & 15 \end{bmatrix} and the variables are x, y, and z.
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations, we can use the Gaussian elimination method on the augmented matrix. We will perform a series of row operations to transform the matrix into its row-echelon form.

1. Swap Row 1 and Row 2 to have the largest absolute value in the first column:

$$\begin{bmatrix} 3 & 5 & 2 & 12 \\ 2 & 3 & 1 & 6 \\ 4 & 7 & 3 & 15 \end{bmatrix}$$

2. Replace Row 2 with (-2/3)Row 1 + Row 2 and Row 3 with (-4/3)Row 1 + Row 3:

$$\begin{bmatrix} 3 & 5 & 2 & 12 \\ 0 & -1 & -1/3 & -6 \\ 0 & -1 & -1/3 & -5 \end{bmatrix}$$

3. Multiply Row 2 by -1:

$$\begin{bmatrix} 3 & 5 & 2 & 12 \\ 0 & 1 & 1/3 & 6 \\ 0 & -1 & -1/3 & -5 \end{bmatrix}$$

4. Replace Row 3 with Row 2 + Row 3:

$$\begin{bmatrix} 3 & 5 & 2 & 12 \\ 0 & 1 & 1/3 & 6 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix}$$

Now we have reached the row-echelon form. Since the last row represents the equation 0x + 0y + 0z = 1, which is a contradiction, we can conclude that the system of linear equations has no solution.
